title: Purse, 1640–1700
medium:
Medium: silk, gold and silver-wrapped silk, horsehair
Technique: tapestry woven
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Small pocketbook, envelope shaped, with pattern in colored silks, gold and silver thread. Pattern of two burning hearts on an altar, supported by cupids with stylized floral sprays at corners. Lined with green silk taffeta.

tombstone.epitaph:
Purse, 1640–1700.
1640–1700. Medium: silk, gold and silver-wrapped silk, horsehair
Technique: tapestry woven. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-55-6.
